intro: Blackstonia perfoliata var. longidens, commonly known as the long-leaf blackstonia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive elongated, lance-shaped leaves that often appear to be fused at the base, creating a perfoliate arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its flowering stems bear small, clustered white or pale green flowers, which are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
